intro: Espeletia × rodriguezii, commonly known as the Rodríguez's espeletia, is a hybrid plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming growth habit and dense, woolly foliage. The plant produces showy, daisy-like inflorescences that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
